file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 31-41-02-04 - EICAS BEZEL - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EICAS BEZEL - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the EICAS bezel. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 31-41-02-000-801-A EICAS BEZEL - REMOVAL ALL 31-41-02-400-801-A EICAS BEZEL - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 31-41-02 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 31-41-02-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. EICAS BEZEL - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the EICAS bezel. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM SDS 24-60-00/1 HYDRAULIC SYSTEM - PRESSURIZATION WITH AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200 EMDP SAFETY PIN OF THE NLG DOORS SOLENOID AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200 VALVE - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL SB145-32-0036 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 114 114BZ Nose landing gear compartment (RH) 223/224 223BZ Cockpit D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the DISPLAY circuit breaker (Location Tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 1/EICAS/DISPLAY) and attach a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to it. (2) (Applicable to aircraft PRE-MOD SB145-32-0036) Make sure that the pressure in hydraulic system 1 is fully released ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 31-41-02 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) (Applicable to aircraft POST-MOD SB145-32-0036) Install the safety pin of the NLG door solenoid valve (AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200). (4) Remove access panel 114BZ (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100) to get access to the backup battery relay box. (5) On the backup battery relay box, open the EICAS DISPLAY circuit breaker (AMM SDS 24-60-00/1) and attach the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to it. J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Remove the two screws (1). (2) Pull the EICAS bezel (2), until it is disconnected from the connector. (3) Remove the EICAS bezel (2). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 31-41-02 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL EICAS BEZEL - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A ZONES 223 224 B DET. A 2. EICAS BEZEL DET. B 1. SCREW (2) 145AMM310131.MCE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 31-41-02 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 31-41-02-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. EICAS BEZEL - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the EICAS bezel. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM SDS 24-60-00/1 SAFETY PIN OF THE NLG DOORS SOLENOID AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200 VALVE - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL SB145-32-0036 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 114 114BZ Nose landing gear Compartment (RH) 223/224 223BZ Cockpit D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Position the EICAS bezel (2) in its location. (2) Push the EICAS bezel (2), until it is connected to the connector. (3) Install the two screws (1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 31-41-02 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from the DISPLAY circuit breaker (Location Tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 1/EICAS/DISPLAY) and close it. (2) On the backup battery relay box, remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from the EICAS DISPLAY circuit breaker (AMM SDS 24-60-00/1) and close it. (3) Install access panel 114BZ (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (4) (Applicable to aircraft POST-MOD SB145-32-0036) Remove the safety pin of the NLG door solenoid valve (AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200). (5) Do the EICAS display bezel test as follows: (a) On the EICAS display panel, turn the control button on the bezel right corner. Result: 1 Make sure that the Caution (amber), Advisory (cyan) and white messages on the EICAS display upper right corner are scrolled up and down. At the end of the list of messages, the END (white) message will come into view. NOTE: If the messages flash, push a master caution lighted pushbutton. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 31-41-02 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
